frame.name: Timetable
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Timetable</fen> of <fen>Events</fen> is a mental object deliberately created, modified or kept by a <fen>Cognizer</fen>. The <fen>Timetable</fen> is often modified by an adjective depicting a <fen>Period_of_iterations</fen> or a dependent noun expressing the <fen>Events</fen> of the <fen>Timetable</fen>.
Note that this frame does not include the physical representation of a timetable.
<ex></ex> As of now this frame does not have an inheritance relationship, but in the future a *Mental_object frame will be developed from which Timetable will inherit. <ex></ex>
<ex>Changes to <fex name="Cog">an employee's</fex> <fex name="Events">work</fex> <t><fex name="tt">schedule</fex></t> should generally be approved prior to the change actually occuring.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Cog">The science students</fex> <m>had</m> <fex name="Descriptor">very full</fex> <t><fex name="tt">timetables</fex></t>; these consisted mainly of lectures, with some lab sessions and problem classes or tutorials.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Timetable
FE.definition:
<def-root>The mental schedule of times at which the <fen>Events</fen> are set to take place.
<ex>My idiot friend forgot his class <t><fex name="tt">schedule</fex></t> again.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Events
FE.definition:
<def-root>The events which are to take place at specified times acording to the <fen>Timetable</fen>.
<ex>What's your <fex name="Events">class</fex> <t>schedule</t> like this spring?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The sentient entity who keeps the <fen>Timetable</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cog">John's</fex> <t>schedule</t> is packed this afternoon.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period within which the <fen>Timetable</fen> repeats.
<ex>Depending on the camper's age group, his or her <fex name="poi">daily</fex> <t>schedule</t> will vary.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_implementation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Events</fen> on the <fen>Timetable</fen> transpire.
<ex>What's on the <t>agenda</t> <fex name="toi">today</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps the <fen>Timetable</fen>.
<ex>You need to develop a weekly <t>timetable</t> <fex name="Purpose">to manage your goals</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the <fen>Timetable</fen>.
<ex>University students have <fex name="Descriptor">very full</fex> <t>schedules</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: schedule.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mental plan of events

lexUnit.name: timetable.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a mental schedule of events

lexUnit.name: agenda.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a plan of things to be done

lexUnit.name: itinerary.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a planned schedule of events and routes, usually used when traveling
